description: Tic-Tac-Toe Terminal Game - Single-player terminal game with unbeatable computer opponent for children aged 10-15

userStories.title: Display empty board with numeric mapping
acceptanceCriteria: Display 3x3 grid in terminal
Show numeric mapping: 1-9 (1=top-left, 2=top-middle, 3=top-right, 4=middle-left, 5=center, 6=middle-right, 7=bottom-left, 8=bottom-middle, 9=bottom-right)
All cells initially empty
Board is large and clear with visible cell labels
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Implemented: tic_tac_toe.js renders empty board with numeric mapping

userStories.title: Display welcome message and initialize session score
acceptanceCriteria: Show welcome message on game launch
Display brief instructions about board mapping and how to enter moves
Initialize session score: Player Wins: 0, Computer Wins: 0, Draws: 0
Display current session score
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Implemented: tic_tac_toe.js provides showWelcome(), instructions, and session score display

userStories.title: Accept player move input (1-9)
acceptanceCriteria: Prompt player for move input
Accept integer input between 1 and 9
Read input from terminal
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Implemented: tic_tac_toe.js provides promptForMove() which prompts and validates integer input 1-9 from terminal

userStories.title: Validate player move input
acceptanceCriteria: Reject non-numeric input with friendly error message
Reject numbers outside 1-9 range with friendly error message
Reject moves to occupied cells with friendly error message
Re-prompt after invalid input without crashing
Handle empty input and whitespace gracefully
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Implemented: promptForMoveValidated(board) validates input for non-numeric, out-of-range, occupied cells, empty input and re-prompts. Uses promptInput() helper to normalize input.

userStories.title: Apply player move and update board
acceptanceCriteria: Place 'X' in selected cell (1-9) when move is valid
Update board display immediately after move
Show updated board with all previous moves visible
Player always uses 'X'
Typecheck passes
userStories.notes: Implemented: applyPlayerMove(board, cellNumber) wrapper and applyMove(board, cellNumber, mark). Updated board display shown after applying move.

userStories.title: Implement win detection (rows, columns, diagonals)
acceptanceCriteria: Detect player win in any row (3 X's in a row)
Detect player win in any column (3 X's in a column)
Detect player win in any diagonal (3 X's in a diagonal)
Detect computer win in any row, column, or diagonal (3 O's)
Detect win immediately after winning move
Do not detect win when three marks are not aligned
Typecheck passes
Tests pass
userStories.notes: Implemented: checkWinner(board) and isBoardFull(board) in tic_tac_toe.js. Tests in test_check_winner.js pass. Returns { winner: 'X'|'O'|null, winningLine: [i,i,i]|null }

userStories.title: Implement draw detection
acceptanceCriteria: Detect draw when board is full (9 moves) and no win condition met
Do not detect draw if there is a win
Typecheck passes
Tests pass

userStories.title: Implement optimal computer move logic
acceptanceCriteria: Computer takes winning move when available (places O to win)
Computer blocks player win when player has two X's in a row/column/diagonal
Computer plays optimally (never loses - always wins or draws)
Computer responds instantly with no noticeable delay
Computer always uses 'O'
Typecheck passes
Tests pass (verify computer never loses in multiple game rounds)

userStories.title: Display win and draw messages
acceptanceCriteria: Display child-friendly win message when player wins
Display child-friendly message when computer wins
Display child-friendly draw message when game ends in draw
Messages are encouraging and appropriate for ages 10-15
Messages are clear and concise
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Track and update session score
acceptanceCriteria: Increment Player Wins by 1 when player wins
Increment Computer Wins by 1 when computer wins
Increment Draws by 1 when game ends in draw
Score persists across multiple rounds in same session
Score resets to 0 when application exits (not persisted)
Typecheck passes
Tests pass

userStories.title: Display session score between rounds
acceptanceCriteria: Show current session score after each game ends
Display score in format: 'Player Wins: X, Computer Wins: Y, Draws: Z'
Score is clearly visible
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Implement replay functionality
acceptanceCriteria: Prompt player to play again after game ends: 'Play again? (y/n)'
Accept 'y' or 'yes' to start new game
Accept 'n' or 'no' to exit game
Reset board to empty state when replaying
Preserve session score when replaying
Handle invalid replay input with friendly error message and re-prompt
New game starts with player's turn
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Implement quit functionality
acceptanceCriteria: Accept 'q' or 'quit' command during move prompt to exit
Accept 'q' or 'quit' command at replay prompt to exit
Handle quit command case insensitively (Q, QUIT, Quit, etc.)
Display farewell message on quit
Application exits gracefully
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Implement game flow and turn sequence
acceptanceCriteria: Player always moves first in new game
Turns alternate: player, then computer, then player, etc.
Game continues until win or draw detected
Board state preserved during turn transitions
No moves lost during transitions
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Polish user experience and messaging
acceptanceCriteria: All messages use clear, age-appropriate language (10-15 years)
Messages avoid technical jargon
Messages are concise with short lines
Board formatting adapts to terminal size constraints
Optional brief hint may be shown after game end (explaining decisive move)
Typecheck passes
